author: Sam Warner
title: Strictly Come Dancing goes to the movies: All the best tweets from tonight's show - Strictly Come Dancing Reality TV
text: Week three of Strictly Come Dancing was movie night, ensuring an array of ridiculous costumes and routines. It also saw its fair share of drama (thanks to Len), and the highest score of the series so far!Naturally, Twitter had a lot to say, and so Digital Spy rounded up the best reactions of the evening for your pleasure. Enjoy! © BBC / Guy LevyAinsley Harriott and Natalie Lowe The opening number, being movie week, was naturally theatrical:You'd have to be a dried up piece of crust not to LOVE #Strictly's wonderful opening to Movie Week. Either that or a Daily Mail reader.— Lorna Cooper (@Coops_tv) October 10, 2015Just as well Iwan left. Don't think I could have coped with a rhumba to Chariots of Fire #SCD— Lily Tomlinson (@lilyvtomlinson) October 10, 2015How FAB-U-LOUS was dat opening number on #Strictly— Rose (@MsRoseCavalier) October 10, 2015The VTs started to get on peoples' nerves slightly:Just once I'd like a celebrity to go, "I wish we had more time to train, but we had to shoot a silly VT instead" #Strictly— Elliot Gonzalez (@elliot_gonzalez) October 10, 2015Anyone else think they'd enjoy this show a bit more without the inane video clips?#Strictly— Emma Salters Austin (@emmajaustin) October 10, 2015If they spent less time doing the crap skits for the VT & more time practicing they maybe able to dance better #Strictly— Anna Pickering (@ban_anna_) October 10, 2015Can't work out if the Strictly Vt's are hilarious or if they want me to throw the TV out of the window & then set fire to the living room— Matt Johnson (@Mattjohnsons) October 3, 2015Len snapped at Giovanni, and it DID NOT go down too well:"That was awful and not even slightly a rumba. You've angered me and I will mark you harshly" in Len Goodman terms this means a 6. #strictly— Mzebonga (@Mzebonga) October 10, 2015Len was a bit out of order there....just basically gave a work colleague a bollocking on national tv. Bit uncalled for #Strictly x— Gemma (@Gxmma_Paulette) October 10, 2015Absolutely no time for Len's disrespectful, cranky outbursts. He never fails to show his true colours each year. It's not on. #SCD #strictly— Emma Hynes (@ELHynes) October 10, 2015Len Goodman getting Medieval with Giovanni #strictly— John Turner (@JaunePeril) October 10, 2015Did Giovanni run over Len's dog? #Strictly— Strictly Dancers (@strictlydancers) October 10, 2015Len Goodman that was aggressive, bullish and rude!! If you have an issue take it aside. Out of order. Not relaxing TV. #strictly #giovanni— Jade Haunting (@jadewritesbooks) October 10, 2015However, it was all about the dancing and one of the first routines was by boxer Anthony Ogogo and Oti Mabuse set to quite a familiar tune:I'm watching Strictly for the first time this series. A professional boxer dancing to Eye Of The Tiger. pic.twitter.com/5D8iwejzTS— Pete Allison (@Pete_Allison) October 10, 2015Anthony dancing to Eye of the Tiger with a boxing theme? You'd think he was a boxer at this rate! #Strictly— Anna Dunne (@Awerka) October 10, 2015Olympics to dancing to 'Eye of the Tiger' in three years. #OlympicLegacy #Strictly— Matt.Spurs (@MattISpurs) October 10, 2015 © BBC / Guy Levy Kellie Bright and Kevin Clifton's Star Wars routine got a rather mixed reaction on Twitter:I felt a great disturbance in the Force, millions of voices cried out in terror & were suddenly silenced #strictly pic.twitter.com/4lnZmlvva3— Simon Alexander (@simon_alexander) October 10, 2015The Star Wars dance happening on #Strictly right now is a thing of demented hilarity. Luke & Leia are dancing to the Cantina band.— Helen O'Hara (@HelenLOHara) October 10, 2015just seen that on #Strictly they are doing a routine to the star wars cantina song. Its almost as sacrilegious as jar jar binks...— stellacreasy (@stellacreasy) October 10, 2015Oh my god. Charleston to the Star Wars cantina music with lightsabers. I've never loved #Strictly more— SINdy (@Tea_Wench) October 10, 2015 The Star Wars routine on #Strictly was good, but I feel it was missing some twerking Stormtroopers...:) pic.twitter.com/9Cs3CZOc4w— Miserly Investor (@miserlyinvestor) October 10, 2015Daniel O'Donnell's Danny Zuko impression didn't convince many people:The screen presence that Daniel O'Donnell brings is just magical #Strictly pic.twitter.com/i0g4LYj23l— Phillip Beauzeville (@Pablo942000) October 10, 2015I'm not sure my eyes are going to be able to take this #Strictly— Mobeenargh Khan (@mobeenakhan) October 10, 2015Daniel:I've got chills. Anyone else? #Strictly— Jane Garvey (@janegarvey1) October 10, 2015Watching #Strictly & each time I see Daniel O'Donnell all I can think of is the Father Ted episode where they all impersonate Elvis.— Peter Elston (@woodcuttersson) October 10, 2015Daniel O'Donnell is doing the Three Ages Of Elvis from Father Ted! Hurrah! #scd— Gee (@BrokenBiros) October 10, 2015Turned on strictly for the first time in my life just in time to see Daniel. pic.twitter.com/BUBK2JeLJD— Miss Rock (@moi_cheree) October 10, 2015Daniel O'Donnell as Danny Zuko from Grease is something that can never be unseen!! #strictly #SCD— Barnsey (@officialbarnsey) October 10, 2015Daniel O'Donnell's hair tonight on #Strictly be like... pic.twitter.com/oIf2xO4KTH— Rob Smedley (@robsmedley86) October 10, 2015#Strictly Daniel O'Donnel looked more like Morrissey than Danny Zuko pic.twitter.com/wo2HCDT9k6— Robin Galloway (@djrobingalloway) October 10, 2015Peter Andre looked set to be the favourite of the evening, though there wasn't too much enthusiasm:Poundland pirate #strictly— Nicola Miller (@NicMillersTale) October 10, 2015Peter Andre. The only person who looks less tanned after going through the #strictly spray tan.— Ben Cavey (@ben_cavey) October 10, 2015"Peter Andre is dressed as a pirate tonight.""Where's the plank?""There. Dressed as a pirate." #strictlycomedancing— Ian Hyland (@HylandIan) October 10, 2015But it was ultimately Jay who stole the evening (and the series so far):Holy moly! @JayMcGuiness is on fire! Move aside Peter! #Strictly pic.twitter.com/eYaAvAcWMf— Millie Dutt (@millsheep) October 10, 2015I think that this young Jay fella's got skills and is a challenger to #PeterAndre. Just sayin'. #Strictly— Toni McDonald (@toniearlybird) October 10, 2015JAYMAZING @JayMcGuiness @AlionaVilani @bbcstrictly— Zoe Ball (@ZoeTheBall) October 10, 2015Legit do not get this "oh it's week 3 so I'll only give it a 9 bollox". If it's a 10 give it a 10. #scd #noboffdarcey— Chris Rubery (@Chrisrubery) October 10, 2015Strictly Come Dancing continues tomorrow on BBC One at 7.15pm
